title: StaticConfig
description: A configuration file used for deployment of crestron programs

Site.description: the site name, sometimes shown on the logo screen of the touch panel

RoomName.description: the system or room name, shown on the header bar of the touch panel

UseExternalDsp.description: set to true if using an external dsp such as a biamp or qsys

DisplayAutoOn.description: set to true if displays should turn on at logo press

RoomAudio.description: maps specific volume controls to DM or DSP faders

ProgramVolume.description: map the program volume control of a room to a dm or dsp fader

MicVolume.description: map the mic volume control of a room to a dm or dsp fader

AtcVolume.description: map the atc volume control of a room to a dm or dsp fader

VtcVolume.description: map the vtc volume control of a room to a dm or dsp fader

PrivacyMute.description: map the privacy mute control of a room to a dm or dsp fader

VTCShareDestination.description: the destination index that is the content or share destination for the VTC

Combinable.description: set to true if this room is combinable with another. not yet implemented

CombinablePosition.description: set the relationship with other rooms. not yet implemented

SourceVisibility.description: an array of boolean indicating that source should be visible for this room

DestinationVisibility.description: an array of boolean indicating that destination should be visible for this room

FaderVisibility.description: an array of boolean indicating that fader should be visible for this room

DisplayVisibility.description: an array of boolean indicating that display should be visible for this room

CameraVisibility.description: an array of boolean indicating that camera should be visible for this room

BasicRoutingDestinations.description: an array of destination indexes that should be routed to when a source is selected

Id.description: a number used to sort this array

Label.description: a unique label for this matrix. this must match a module parameter in crestron code. talk to your programmer before changing or adding

Inputs.description: the number of inputs on this matrix

Outputs.description: the number of outputs on this matrix

IP.description: the ip address or hostname of the matrix switcher

Username.description: the username to log into matrix switcher

Password.description: the password to log into matrix switcher

InputLabels.description: an array of strings in order of input

OutputLabels.description: an array of strings in order of output

Label.description: the text shown on buttons and other elements

Icon.description: the icon to shown on the panel

Location.description: the location of the source. not all projects use this property

ShowControls.description: the type of controls to show. set to nothing '' if there is no controls

Message.description: the text to show if message is the ShowControls

Input.description: the input on the matrix switcher this source is plugged into

Matrix.description: the matrix index number this source uses

IrPort.description: the ir port address to use. IR ports on the processor uses 0.[port-number]. Transmitters use 5X.1. Receivers use 7X.1

SerialPort.description: the serial port address to use. Serial ports on the processor uses 0.[port-number]. Transmitters use 5X.1. Receivers use 7X.1

DriverPath.description: the driver dll or pkg file to be used. talk to your programmer for valid drivers and implementation

DisableDestinations.description: an array of destination indexes that should be disabled when this source is selected.

items.description: the index of the destination to be disabled

DeviceIndex.description: the device index when multiple sources have the same showcontrols

PreviewUrl.description: the url to be used in as a preview image for this source

Icon.description: the icon to shown on the panel

Label.description: the text shown on buttons and other elements

Location.description: the location of the source. not all projects use this property

ShowVideoMute.description: show the mute button on the destination

Output.description: the output on the matrix switcher this destination is plugged into

Matrix.description: the matrix index number this destination uses

RoutingRules.description: an array of strings that govern how sources are routed to destinations

oneOf.description: tie a source to a matrix input
tie a matrix to another matrix
avoid a matrix output when routing a destination

defaultSnippets.label: Tie Source
defaultSnippets.description: tie a source to a matrix input

defaultSnippets.label: Follow
defaultSnippets.description: Set a destination to follow another destination

defaultSnippets.label: Tie Destination
defaultSnippets.description: tie a destination to a matrix output

defaultSnippets.label: Mirror Group Add
defaultSnippets.description: add a destination to a Mirror Group

defaultSnippets.label: Tie Matrices
defaultSnippets.description: tie a matrix output to another matrix's input

defaultSnippets.label: Avoid Path
defaultSnippets.description: adds a rule to avoid a matrix output when routing to a destination

Id.description: a number used for sorting this array

Label.description: the text shown on the touch panel

Icon.description: the icon shown on the touch panel

Location.description: the physical location of the device. usually a room name

IsAProjector.description: set to true if device is a projector. used for setting visibility on screen, video mute, or lamp hours visibility

HasScreen.description: set to true to show screen up/down controls

DriverPath.description: the driver path to use to control this display

SerialPort.description: physical port address to control the display

IrPort.description: physical port address to control the display

CecPort.description: physical port address to control the display

IP.description: ip address to control the display

DSP.description: defines the connection to a dsp and objects to subscribe to and maps to faders

IP.description: the ip address of the dsp

Username.description: username used to control the dsp

Password.description: password used to control the dsp

Snapshots.description: qsys snapshots. these will be used as a dsp preset to be recalled

items.description: the snapshot name and bank number

Bank.description: the bank number in the snapshot to recall or load

Enable.description: enables the voip modules in code

RxLevelInstanceTag.description: instance of level block to be used a atc receive volume control

RxLevelChannel.description: the channel number in the level block

RxMuteInstanceTag.description: instance of level block to be used a atc receive mute control

RxMuteChannel.description: the channel number in the level block

EnablePrivacy.description: enables the privacy mute modules in code

PrivacyInstanceTag.description: instance of level or mute block to be used a atc receive mute control

PrivacyChannel.description: the channel number in the level block

ControlStatusInstanceTag.description: instance tag of Control Status block

Id.description: a number that is used to sort the array

Label.description: text to shown on the touch panels

Location.description: text to shown on the touch panels

HasLevel.description: used to show or hide the slider or up/down controls on the touchpanel

HasMute.description: used to show or hide the mute button on the touchpanel

MuteType.description: controls the icon shown on the mute button. 0 = speaker icon, 1 = mic icon

LevelControl.description: the instance tag or named control for controlling the level

MuteControl.description: the instance tag or named control for controlling the mute

LevelIndex.description: the channel number in the level block

MuteIndex.description: the channel number in the level or mute block

Id.description: a number used to sort the array

Label.description: text shown on the touch panel as the device's name

Location.description: text shown on the touch panel. not often used

IP.description: the ip address of the device

PanSpeed.description: pan speed of the camera to use. Value is dependent camera make and model.

TiltSpeed.description: pan speed of the camera to use. Value is dependent camera make and model.

ZoomSpeed.description: pan speed of the camera to use. Value is dependent camera make and model.

PreviewType.description: the type of stream to use as the camera preview. one of mjpeg, h264 or image.

Username.description: username to log into and control the device

Password.description: password to log into and control the device

Preset.description: an array of strings to show as the presets of a camera

IP.description: the ip address of the device

Username.description: username to log into and control the device

Password.description: password to log into and control the device

PresetRoutes.description: an array of preset. a preset can have many routes in it.

Id.description: a number used to sort the array

Label.description: a quick description of the route

Source.description: a source index to be routed. use -1 for 'clear', or use the index of a 'Blank' source

Destination.description: a destination index for the source to be routed to. this is ignored if All Destiantions is true

AllDestinations.description: set to true if source is to be routed to all destinations

Id.description: a number used to sort the array

LogoPassword.description: if not empty, a password will be prompted when the user presses the logo. usually a 4 digit pin

Startup.description: values to be set on the panel at logo press

Menu.description: the menu index to be set. use -1 to not set any

AudioGroup.description: the audio group index to be set. use -1 to not set any

Source.description: the source index to be set. use -1 to not set any

DestinationGroup.description: the destination group index to be set. use -1 to not set any

DisplayGroup.description: the display group index to be set. use -1 to not set any

TechMenu.description: the tech menu index to be set. use -1 to not set any

Menus.description: an array of menu items. menus are buttons on the bottom of the touch panel. this must be mapped in the crestron code. talk to your programmer before adding items

Id.description: a number used to sort the array

Visible.description: makes the button visible if true

Icon.description: the icon to show on the button

Source.description: the source to be selected, as if it was pressed, when this menu button is pressed. use -1 to indicate none

PresetRoute.description: executes a preset route when the menu button is pressed. use -1 to indicate none

SourceGroup.description: executes a source group button press when this menu button is pressed. use -1 to indicate none

Message.description: if mapped to message popup, then this will be text shown on the touch panel

Password.description: if not empty, then a password will be prompted from the user before moving on. it must match the password here

TechMenus.description: the menu in the hidden or adv page. usually by pressing the upper left logo on the touch panel. talk to your programmer before adding more items

Id.description: a number used to sort the array

Visible.description: makes the button visible if true

PageStyles.description: governs the right volume control and the routing or presentation page is shown

Volume.description: determines what to show on the right side for volume control

anyOf.description: program volume, mic mute, and privacy

Routing.description: determines what to show on the presentation or routing page

SourcesVisible.description: determines if the touch panel should show the source matching its index

DestinationsVisible.description: determines if the touch panel should show the destination matching its index

FadersVisible.description: determines if the touch panel should show the fader matching its index

CamerasVisible.description: determines if the touch panel should show the camera matching its index

ShareSourceVisibility.description: an array of boolean indicating that the source should be visible as a vtc share source

VideoWallLayoutsVisible.description: an array of boolean indicating the video wall layout should be visible

DisplayGroups.description: an array of strings that will show as buttons, acting as filters on GroupTags of displays

items.description: a tag used in GroupTags of a display

AudioGroups.description: an array of strings that will show as buttons, acting as filters on GroupTags of faders

items.description: a tag used in GroupTags of a fader

SourceGroups.description: an array of strings that will show as buttons, acting as filters on GroupTags of sources

items.description: a tag used in GroupTags of a source

DestinationGroups.description: an array of strings that will show as buttons, acting as filters on GroupTags of destinations

items.description: a tag used in GroupTags of a destination

RoomStartupShutdown.description: sets the startup properties of a room such as volume or a preset

PresetRoute.description: The index number of a preset route. Use -1 to indicate no preset route

ProgramVolumeLevel.description: the percentage value to set program volume level. This is ignored if a dsp preset is defined.

MicVolumeLevel.description: the percentage value to set mic volume level. This is ignored if a dsp preset is defined.

VtcVolumeLevel.description: the percentage value to set vtc volume level. This is ignored if a dsp preset is defined.

DspPreset.description: the dsp preset index number to run at room system on or startup. Use -1 to indicate no dsp preset

DMAddress.description: maps a specific volume to a DM address usually used in a DMPS system. Use -1 to indicate none

DSPFader.description: the index of a dsp fader. Use -1 to indicate none

GroupTags.description: an array of strings to associate with this display, used in filtering
